forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 54. Southwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 67, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As night descends on Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a gentle coolness, cradling the city with a low temperature hovering around 54 degrees. Though partly cloudy, the sky seems to offer brief glimpses of clarity, hinting at the promise of an uncommonly bright Friday. The soft southwesterly breeze, a mere whisper at eight miles per hour, plays a delicate symphony between the buildings and the bay, beckoning those willing to embrace the evening's tranquility.

Tomorrow, the sun will awaken the city, casting a golden sheen on the resilient structures of steel and glass, warming them to a peak around 67 degrees before gently retreating to a comfortable 65 by afternoon's embrace. Though some remnants of the marine layer cling to the bay, framing the iconic Golden Gate Bridge in a misty embrace, Friday’s forecast will favor sun-kissed explorations. The wind, playful yet unobtrusive at six to thirteen miles per hour, allows for a casual jaunt, invigorating the spirit without overwhelming it. Dress comfortably; light layers will serve you well, as might a light jacket for those early morning hours or as the sun begins its descent. So, why not take a stroll along the Embarcadero, indulging in a quiet moment by the water, where reflections of clouds dance playfully on the surface? Alternatively, find solace in one of the city's many parks, perhaps with a good book, letting the warmth of the day cradle your thoughts and aspirations.
